website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys E4200 v2 makes a great upgrade to the original version and an excellent investment for those who need a fast, feature-rich, advanced, yet easy-to-use router for the home or even a small business.
pros: Cisco Systems' Linksys E4200 v2 Maximum Performance Dual-Band N900 router offers true dual-band with concurrent 450Mbps, Gigabit Ethernet, excellent storage and 5GHz wireless throughput, and a nice set of networking features
The router looks good and includes Cisco Connect, an intuitive software application that helps home users set up and manage a home wireless network with ease
cons: The Linksys E4200 v2's range throughput speed on the 2.4GHz band could be better
The included desktop application can't be used to manage all of the router's settings, doesn't work well with the Web interface, and requires a live Internet connection for the initial setup

customer_reviews.title: You have to read this before purchasing!!  ARRIVED OUT OF WARRANTY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually leave reviews, especially negative ones, but I purchased this router only to find out that it was DOA. I contacted Cisco support who was reluctant to help me because the serial number of the unit that I received is no longer eligible for warranty or technical support. They told me that based on the purchase date, they would give me one session of courtesy support, but after that they tried to sell me a new router to replace my old, out of warranty one! Save yourself problems and don't buy something that comes out of the box expired!!
customer_reviews.author: Jfowler

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, this router was easy to set up and performs very well. I inserted the CD into my computer, followed the on-screen instructions, and was up and running in 15 minutes. I was somewhat apprehensive since I'm not a computer pro and had never installed a router before, but this couldn't have been easier. Setting up the other computers and printers did take a while longer, but they were just as easy even though some were wireless devices and some not. In addition, the seller (O Mama) sent the router on time and in good condition. I would rate the seller as excellent also.
customer_reviews.author: tea lover

customer_reviews.title: Love my new router...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my old Linksys 54Mps router and now have this dual band Wireless N router. It has the WPS feature that will allow easy configuration to and from other devices and a guest feature. the best feature to me is the ability to attach multple usb devices. I use it attached to two portable hard drives as a NAS and save and access my photos, videos and movies that i've recorded. Cost on Amazon also beat out others like New Egg, best buy, etc...
customer_reviews.author: bigqdone

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended - IT Professional
customer_reviews.text: Have had this unit almost 2 years. At just about 1 year it started giving me problems. Called Tech support and did a firmware update and reset to factory defaults and reconfigured. Worked for about 3 months and then could no longer access device to update/change configurations. Had to reset again to factory defaults. Have problems with intermittent WIFI connectivity. Overall, for a top end router, I'm very disappointed in Linksys/Cisco, they usually have superior products. Not this time...
customer_reviews.author: AmsoilMan

customer_reviews.title: Decent router
customer_reviews.text: as far as speeds go this router is great, I just wasn't too happy with all this focus on linksys smart wifi. it seems to make configuring the router more of a pain even if remote. I don't need to really configure it remotely so it's kind of useless in that sense. I thought there would be more focus with web apps with this device, but they seem to not work and work not well or mainly meant for ios and no good android support. as far as a router goes it's great, but the bells and whistles aren't executed very well.
customer_reviews.author: Halfrotech

customer_reviews.title: Super easy installation; blazing speed.
customer_reviews.text: I found a review of this router on Cnet and thought I'd give it a try. I was looking for overall better performance for our network, especially for computers that were further away and our streaming devices. A little spendy but man, what an improvement over my 8 year old Linksys. The installation cd made it super easy. I entered the same password that I had on my previous router and BAM, it discovered all of my computers and devices and all were seamlessly integrated. I noticed a dramatic increase in speed immediately. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: NoGeek

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E4200 v2
customer_reviews.text: This wi-fi router has bee superseded. I purchased it because the newer routers have all kinds of things that I'm not interested in. So far the router works. I only give it four stars because my computer loses the gateway or some other thing to keep me from accessing the Internet. This router does not have any lights on the front so that you can tell what's happening. You have to look at the back where the cables are plugged in. I do not know if I am getting the combo speeds that the dual-band router is supposed to be capable of.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L Cross Jr

customer_reviews.title: Lightning Fast
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize just how slow my other router was. My pc is in another room and it always had a little lag. Not anymore. This new E4200 v2 is the easiest router I have ever setup. Pop the disk in, set your network SSID and password and BAM! DONE! Pages load so much faster. I no longer have to wait to stream a movie on YouTube and change its video quality, I can watch in 1080 HD with no streaming issues. The real test will come when I get my new cell phone which will use VOIP calling. Stay tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P...

customer_reviews.title: Linksys DualBand N900 Router
customer_reviews.text: The router arrived quickly and functioned as described. However, when my security company called for technical support, the technical support person was not helpful, pushing the problem to the internet service provider, which was not the source of the problem. I returned the router and purchased a different brand. The router was easy to insatll including creating a custom password. The Amazon distributor issued a compete refund including my cost of returning the router.
customer_reviews.author: K. Morgenstern

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product thinking I was buying a quality and reliabiliable piece of equipment. Unfortunately, it is an inferior product which is not reliable. The signal strength changes all the time for no apparent reason. I also have been disconnected from the internet several times for no known reason. My PS3 is literally 25 feet from it and the singal bar strength is mostly a 2, sometimes a 3! I wish I had returned it right away when I first noticed it. Don't buy it, it is junk!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Router was fairly easy to set-up. I was having problems streaming video with my other router, so decided to try this dual band. I am very pleased with the results so far. I have Netflix and Amazon Prime and both do very well using the recommended band for streaming. My step-daughter is across the street and is able to connect to the guess option. Would recommend this router to anyone that needs a powerful router with dual bands,
customer_reviews.author: RJLOPEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I needed a router that could cover a pretty large area and with several people accessing it. I read the reviews and selected this router. I had one issue with getting it going, and as the Cisco had sold the company, it took a bit of time to find the right customer support (which is why I deducted one star from my rating), but once I got it working, it has performed admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon K

customer_reviews.title: This router is absolutely terrible and the setup is a headache
customer_reviews.text: This worked in the beginning, and then very quickly stopped. I spent way too much time with customer support trying to get it to work - they eventually told me it was broken and that I should send it back. No instructions were in the box, nor was the setup CD. Went to Target the same night, paid half the price I did for this one and got it up and running in under 3 minutes. Go with NETGEAR over linksys. This router is absolutely terrible and the setup is a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prompt service
customer_reviews.text: I got htis product quickly and set it up almost immediately. It was easy to set up and is an attractive router compared to the previous one I had Linksys. i expect better strength quality from the reviews since I live in a two story home like some others. I wanted to give it 5 stars but will have to give it 4 since the design of my home is pretty open and expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Ufunni

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Pro - Its Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Wi-Fi professional so I took weeks making a decision on a new AP. This one met all my expectations for coverage and speed. No issues with macs, pcs, android and iphones, tables and iPads. Actually have 15 computers, phones and tablets using this wifi AP in our 3500sqft home all day and all night - everything from email to youtube to xbox and PC gaming. Latency and speed are great. There seem like some good deals on new products, consider it a deal!
customer_reviews.author: Hood River Crew

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I replaced by ancient Linksys WRT54G router (circa 2009) with this today. Cable company replaced my modem over the weekend and suddenly I couldn't connect all my devices to the internet. Bit the bullet and ordered this one based on reviews. Within 15 minutes of opening the box I'm back online and running faster than ever. I'm very pleased so far. I did turn off the port lights, per a previous review, to reduce heat. We'll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: SheaBean

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different router !
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the unit and it turns out that a Cisco E4200A router was sent. Linksys bought Cisco routers out and they will not provide the 90 day warranty. It is also very difficult to set up. Buy a different router !
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Barton

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. 1) Easy to set-up (less than 20 minutes) 2) Guest network for friends and families that uses a separate password. It is not a secure network, but people with smart phones, tablets and laptops won't need your secure network password to browse the web. Perfect for our home! 3) We currently have 6 devices installed and we rarely have connectivity issues. We even have a bluray, a PC, and a laptop in the basement that have a strong signal. Our prior router didn't work for any devices in the basement. A super product for a great price. I would definitely recommend this product for any home with multiple users.
customer_reviews.author: ILuvLife, Oakdale MN

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but wasn't a big improvement
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace my existing Linksys WRT54GL. I have about 10 wireless devices connected to my router at any given time so I was hoping that switching to a wireless N router would give me an improvement in speed and reliability. The router works fine, but I haven't noticed any difference between it and my prior router. I was hoping it would fix my android tablet's connection issues. Occasionally the tablet shows it is connected to the network, but I have to turn off the wireless and turn it back on to get internet connectivity back. This new router didn't fix that issue so I suspect it is a problem with the tablet, not my network.
customer_reviews.author: Philip D BoBo

customer_reviews.title: What a difference it makes.
customer_reviews.text: Had a Netgear router for years and it would work, but it would "forget" what wireless devices were allowed to connect. Picked up a Belkin that was absolute garbage. Dropped wireless connections EVERY day, and even when connected it was very slow for wireless. Picked this up and everything is awesome. Speed is up to where it used to be and works fine with N-band, and coming home and having my phone automatically connect is awesome. Had it for about a month and haven't had to reboot it once. With the others it was at best a once a week ordeal.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Derr

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for My needs.!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best router for my needs...I don't have a fast internet...its only 12mbts...whenever I was using a single band router, it kept buffering every 10min whenever I stream video; but now thanks to this dual band N900 (E4200) the 10 min buffering stopped...well kind of...but its 100% better.
customer_reviews.author: sellbuygoodstuff

customer_reviews.title: Fast and a GREAT price!!
customer_reviews.text: Charter increased my speed to 100 mbs so I need a new router to handle the speed. This one is up to the task. It clocked at 93.4 mbs. Close enough for my needs. Simple plug and play set-up. Even I could make it go without a problem!
customer_reviews.author: bkkrdd

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this Linksys Router. I put it up inside the house and I get a good signal outside at the back of the yard. My old G router could barely get a signal across the living room. Plus, this one permits online controlling of settings and passwords. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Good router for Internet connection but...
customer_reviews.text: Good router for the most part and was very easy to install. I got my my wireless Internet connected and my wireless printer connection for my all-in-one printer without any problems. However, when it came to scanning wirelessly from my all-in-one printer/fax/scanner it did not work and was a major hassle. I called Cisco support and they cannot or will not help you connect other devices such as printers or scanners to the this router. I had to call a third-party tech support company to help me get my scanner to work wirelessly. I had to pay for support and it took about 2.5 hours on the phone before I was able to use my scanner wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: DEX

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I am not giving five starts is just because once in a while some of my laptops lose their connection to the router. this issue does not happen very often nor does it happen with all the laptops in the house. (by the way, all laptops are HP with N capabilities)
customer_reviews.author: Shopper123

customer_reviews.title: The Best it could happen to your internet at home
customer_reviews.text: Really this has Belén One of the Best things I Havre ever purchased relates to technology. I hace connected to the router 3 phones, 2 tablets, 2 computers, 1 IPod, 1 Game console, 1 media player and 1 printer. Alll of them really works perfect, the speed is awesome, while it Toledo me with my old roture to transfer a 1 Gb file 3 hours, with this One I can make it in 5 minutes. The range of the signal is very good even when I have very thick walls at my apt. You just install it and you forget completely about it. It really worth what you pay for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Alarcon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy basic install for the technically challenged, but has a fair few advanced features. I love having the 5ghz channel, ssl management access, and plenty of range (can now play pandora in the kitchen without hiccups), and wireless hd streaming is is great on the local network.
customer_reviews.author: Msinformation

customer_reviews.title: Great router but don't like the "Big brother factor"
customer_reviews.text: I have both this version 2 and the version 1 and prefer the version 1 because it can use third party firmware and seems to be a little more stable, If you get this version 2, I sugest downgrading the firmware to the older non cloud connect version. Otherwise very good router, great range.
customer_reviews.author: Tester

customer_reviews.title: Good but a bit fragile
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these for live portable support. They are cased up and protected but one died somehow. They're very reliable and the wifi is decent. The flat antennae is nice, nothing external to stow or collapse
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin N. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router, great price.
customer_reviews.text: What is there to say? The router was extremely easy to install. I'm not really a techie and iIt took all of 10 minutes to get it up and running and that included removing it from the box. I have 5 or 6 devices around my home that connect to the internet and all came up without a hitch. I also noted a welcome speed increase over the router that I was replacing. It's been running for 3 weeks now, 24/7 and no problems whatsoever. I'm even using a USB drive I have attached to the router as a music/video server for my DVD player. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: James J Cuccarese

customer_reviews.title: E4200v2 freezes and locks
customer_reviews.text: I have been running this router for about six months. I works just fine most of the time, good performance but url logging and event logging is virtually useless. You can't install DD-WRT. In addition it freezes or locks up once or twice a week - even if the only device on the network is an ip camera. That's not good. Firmware is current at 2.0.37. I cannot recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Rudi Freysinger

customer_reviews.title: Great home Router
customer_reviews.text: You want an good router for wireless or lan this is the one. Did need additional setting adjustments to get it all to work through research on the web. software does setup a secure wireless network. Overall great solution for network and wireless internet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff wallen

customer_reviews.title: Best home router I've had
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a lot of home routers over the last 15 years. This is by far the best one to date. It configures well, it survives power fluctuations and outages, and it keeps wireless connections well.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Held

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This router is the best I have owned. Has built in everything plus USB ports. Also physically it looks nice but I wish Linksys would bring back the stackable routers/modems and put those back into style. Really miss those designs, I wish they never stopped making them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Martin

customer_reviews.title: Performed better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Covered more area of my home than previous AT&T uverse wifi/router. Got even more devices on this router and have not noticed any degradation in performance due to torrents/netflix/PCs. Have about 10 devices on wifi and 4 on RJ45. Speed have been very good at 36Mbps from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: CTai

customer_reviews.title: Keeping me connected.....
customer_reviews.text: I have always used linksys products, there is no substitute. But at this price it was a no brainer. Got here when promised and works great. I have 6 laptops, 6 phones and 3 Kindles hooked up and surfing flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: cski1

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: VERY GOOD PRODUCT, just like the PHOTO IS OF GOOD QUALITY AND A LOT LIKE ME, AND DO NOT WRITE AND ASK THAT TWENTY MORE WORDS IS MUCH SORRY, BUT THE PRODUCT IS GOOD
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Maximum Performance Dual-Band N900 Router (E4200 v2)
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was very quick and packaged very well. I believe it was very easy to install as my hubby handled the installation. So far everything has been working great.
customer_reviews.author: love2craft

customer_reviews.title: Performance drops after 2 years... no helpful diagnostics.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since 2012 - the first 2 years are great. But right now one of the protocol is not working well. The range has dropped slightly -- not sure if it's interference or not.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a year until a power outage took ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year until a power outage took on the unit. I wish it was built to be a little more resilient, but it worked fine before the power outage took it out of commission.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Linksys E4200
customer_reviews.text: This is a better router than I have ever had. so with that in mind > YES it is an excellent device and performs much better than what I have ever had. I think any issue would be it introduces a guest user that confused us in the family at first but we are used to it now.
customer_reviews.author: Bill neve

customer_reviews.title: Strong dual band n900 router
customer_reviews.text: I love this router's performance and web tools. The only hiccup was the very beginning with setup. The setup disk didn't work and even the live chat operator couldn't walk me through. Luckily, the internet came to my rescue. Since then I've had multiple devices on at the same time and downloading PS4 games with no issues. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jamar A. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent unit. My provider supplied a router which failed within a month. I installed this unit quickly and easily using the online assistance. I would highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Biermister

customer_reviews.title: Works well after a few probs getting it going
customer_reviews.text: Had some initial trouble swapping the E4200v2 in to replace my 4-year-old Linksys WRT150N. Contacted Cisco/Linksys home support and though it took almost 90 minutes, we finally got the unit to connect through my cable modem. No prob getting my LAN working, just couldn't connect to the internet until I attached my laptop directly to the router to configure it from scratch. A pain, yes, but the support person was super helpful and patient with my frustrations. I like the unit's lightweight, slim profile and if it lasts 4+ years like my previous router I'll be a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: zed00

customer_reviews.title: Electrical contractor review
customer_reviews.text: lovin this router - very good coverage (3,800 sq ft inside area covered plus about 50 ft outside) We haven't had to reset this router even one time - have it up and running quisk and easy - has priviate channel plus visitor band - been in use for about a year now. great buy - unless you are convinced that 12/21/12 is the end - ouch!!
customer_reviews.author: BikerWalt

customer_reviews.title: Considerable difference in performance. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router last week and am blown away with the performance of this router. I have atleast four different devices at any given time and this purchase has definitely improved my ability to utilize all of them at the same time effectively. A lot of reviews mention lack of range or performance but Mimo is not a silver bullet to existing issues caused by absorption and interference of signals through large walls and other materials in buildings.
customer_reviews.author: Sujeet B.

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I followed the steps in the connection guide. I knew I was in trouble when I connected the ethernet cable to my cable modem (ARRIS) and the connection indicator lights stayed dark (i.e. on the ethernet port). I tried resetting the router by pressing and holding the button for over 30 seconds, no changed. I then chatted with the Linksys tech and spent an hour troubleshooting with him. No luck. I had to return the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Louie

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This router has been reliable. I have owned several linksys routers with no problems. I upgraded from the E1000 to E4200v2 to handle increased Internet streaming in my home.
customer_reviews.author: RUSH

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: The product is sleek and compact, and provides solid and no disturbing wireless internet. the multiple features of setting up the router are simple and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: K. Buranasombati

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I loved it while it worked. Easy set up. Great range, but lasted only a year and 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up for a router that doesn't need constant reboots
customer_reviews.text: The setup was nice and easy. I had it up and running with a couple of laptops & a smartphone connected in under an hour. I've been running this wireless router for just over 3 months now and it hasn't dropped connection like my previous Netgear router did (I will avoid Netgear at all cost). I love the guest network that allows internet access to my visitors while blocking access to all the machines on my network. I would recommened this router. I gave only 4 stars as it was a little expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted and needed greater distance for my wireless signal in my house. I have much experience with Linksys products so I decided on this. I am very pleased with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: jbb09

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This router was a snap to set up. It's performed beautifully and has made using wifi a breeze. The signal is strong and reliable. Haven't had a bit of trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bopper

customer_reviews.title: Best router Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best router ever. I love the router its amaizing so fast. I use to get only 3 mb a sec. But now with the Internet Download Manager and this router i get 300 mbs a sec
customer_reviews.author: Monochromemoose

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing...strong signal
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent upgrade from my old Linksys router. Easy to setup and use promptly. Strong signal allowing great reception throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Swim Dad

customer_reviews.title: Linksys is quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router. Easy to install and manage for a home network. I have had other brands in the past but always seem to return to Linksys products.
customer_reviews.author: MarshaLeigh

customer_reviews.title: Not better than e4200
customer_reviews.text: I had the same brand, but the e4200. Two rooms away, in a wood frame house, the signal was already very weak. The E4200v2 promised a better range, but it did not. Same lousy signal strength! No improvement in the speed either. Big waste of money. Stick to the 4200. Do not get the v2.
customer_reviews.author: Geza Z. Madarasz

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: Very good Router. I never have any problem with this Linksys. My old Router I had to constantly reboot. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: High performance router for home or small business
customer_reviews.text: I've had Linksys routers for many years and have always had good experiences with them. This one is no exception. I don't use (or even install) the Cisco Connect software that comes with it as I find the Web interface is more complete and provides more granular control of your network. This product offers high speed wireless, great security, gigabit wired ports and takes just a few minutes to set up and run. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: AbeK

customer_reviews.title: Linksys E4200 v2
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research on line to find a router that would be easy to set up and with enough band width for my purposes today and going forward. The E4200 v2 is expensive and there were a couple of mixed opinions about its performance. However, I have found it to be fantastic! I think it took me all of 5 minutes to set up, that process went perfectly, and my laptop, printer, Netflix and XBox were up an running without a hitch. I live in a small apartment, so I can't comment on the range, but I consistently get 144 Mbs of service connection. Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: RoadKingCowboy

customer_reviews.title: every thing i wanted
customer_reviews.text: little disappointing you need specific hard drives to use as network storage look at the linksys site to find out witch ones work
customer_reviews.author: Jamies

customer_reviews.title: similar problems as other reviews
customer_reviews.text: First year I did not have any noticeable difficulties with this router but am now consistently having my wireless connection go in and out. I have Time Warner Cable come out twice and there are no other issues. It is definitely this router. I am very disappointed based on the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: After using it for 6 months. The modem stopped working. It keeps restarting itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: linksys e4300 v2
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up, was functional in 15 minutes, easy to connect to my smart TV, Iphone,lap tops and printers. Is also listed as recommened by comcast.
customer_reviews.author: GWR

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Works Like New
customer_reviews.text: Customer reviews of the products helped us decide on whether this was the right router for our home use and how it would work for us. It looks and works like new and is providing great range for our wireless throughout our 2000 square home. For the price, we are very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kenyon L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: Our other router could not handle the speed of our internet so we decided to look into others and few people recommended this on so we bought it and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Harrell

customer_reviews.title: I had nothing but complaints with my previous router, now nothing but praise from my boys!
customer_reviews.text: My previous router constantly needed to be reset by my boys, who stream content and play the xbox. Since I have gotten this router there has been absolutely no problems or resets. Great product, would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic Router with Avery strong signal as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: GDS

customer_reviews.title: Overkill, but great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router as a replacement for a Linksys G-router that lasted about 6 years. I was looking for range because my computer is about 60 feet away and 3 walls. This router is extremely easy to set up with the software. The advanced interface is almost the same as previous Linksys/Cisco routers if you need things like static IP address and other features. Overall, the features that it has are overkill for my needs, but the range and speed are excellent. In addition, this router has a reasonable size and looks very futuristic (cool). It is a relatively expensive piece of equipment, but I like it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Cambridge

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: The product is good, cable guy recoment it, fast but need quick instruction on how to fine tune narrow band to make it work better.
customer_reviews.author: Youngyout Narongvate

customer_reviews.title: Electronica Direct ROCKS! - Best Wireless Router on the market TODAY!
customer_reviews.text: The seller is very reliable and the product was delivered promptly ahead of schedule. It works very well and have had no issues to-date. This is my 2nd E4200v2 router that I am using in another house. Setup was less than 10 minutes and after that I have forgotten that I have a wireless router in use at my home. It keeps chugging along 24/7. Great PRODUCT & a ROCK SOLID SELLER!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Moon in Paradise!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This router was easy to set up and use. It is exactly as described. I Recommend for non-computer savvy folks like me.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ivey

customer_reviews.title: Costs a bit more, but works great. Easy set-up.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for two months now, it was easy to set up and works very reliably compared to my previous Apple Airport, which kept needing to be reset.
customer_reviews.author: Brian in Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Router
customer_reviews.text: The good: Easy to set up. iOS App function. Guest mode. Good range, even through walls. Fast, Powerful Reliable The bad: 5 Ghz range is considerably shorter then 2.4 Ghz This is a great router for any regular size home or apartment.
customer_reviews.author: TheSzar13

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Wireless Router. Great Range. Great Performance. Easy Set-Up.
customer_reviews.text: However, probably my last Linksys. Cisco purchased Linksys and are moving all configuration software to their cloud. Newer Linksys Routers need to connect to Internet to configure!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Positive Product
customer_reviews.text: This is my third product purchased over the years from linksys. This product, to date, has performed without a snag. The router is on the main floor with the computer on the second floor and the connections are right on time after time. The product and your price, are exceptional. Thank You for having it in your inventory. We will continue to utilize your services and this outstanding companys products.
customer_reviews.author: Bacsi

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy with their software. When I get close enough to it my iPad connects without incident. The ethernet connections work fine. I haven't used the USB connection yet but I expect it to be just as reliable as the rest of the router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing this router my wireless service was limited to a small area in my living room. I now have service Anywhere... upstairs, basement, everywhere, in the house as well as front and backyards. Set up was easy for me (boomer friendly) and everyone that visits. Needless to say I think it is well worth it. Plus the cost will be made up with deduction on my bill every month.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Flying on the net
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and works great. Better range than my old router. Looks nice and was reasonably priced. I very highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: A real router
customer_reviews.text: My family has an ever expanding list of electronics, an my old $50 router just couldn't keep up. This Linksys is top rated by CNet, and I see why. None of our toys get dropped anymore, and the range allows us to actually go outside.
customer_reviews.author: Klint 77

customer_reviews.title: fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: this router has a very large coverage area. the speed is very good. it works well for our four computers and two printers
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old router it replaced.
customer_reviews.text: New router has significantly better range than the previous Cisco wireless N router which I had been using. Very compact unit.
customer_reviews.author: Boxstah

customer_reviews.title: Great Router, confused by the bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: This router is great. I won't go into the gritty details as other already have, however I previously had the E3000, and I tried both this and the Netgear N900 and for my money this Linksys wins hands down. I have my Xbox hard wired to the router, and my desktop connected wirelessly I frequently stream content from my desktop with no problems using this router. With the other 2 routers mentioned, the quality is spotty at best.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Configurable
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price. No wrt however a lot of option to configure. Only drawback is that it can not do VPNs.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Angeles

customer_reviews.title: It does what I want it to do
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced an old WRT350N router I had been using now for years. With cell phones, game systems, laptops, etc all hooked up wirelessly in my house, the old router just couldn't keep up and had to be replaced. I am not a very serious gamer or anything but I do like having a decent wireless connection without having cords strung around my house. This router did the trick. I can still play games and other things at a much better connection speed without losing packets and games freezing. I am pleased so far with this router and the only knock I have on it is the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Benbinbeen

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: Good router. Easy to set up and manage. Love the dual-band. Could use a little more range, yet still effective.
customer_reviews.author: Dean W. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless router
customer_reviews.text: I had Belkin N router and it was always having problems dropping packets, I got this router and I am glad I did. I ran a speed test with my Belkin router before changing it out with the cisco and was getting 10mps download. Same speed test with the cisco and I got 20mps download. This was on a wired connection and wireless connection on my computer and Xoom Android tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Moderatley fast with short range in house with lots of rooms.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, but in our location the speed and range is only so so. Even with two re1000 extenders its still nowhere near the performance of even 100mbit wired ethernet anywhere pAst 10m from unit.
customer_reviews.author: EAI

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: It works and I love it. What more can I say? I'm no techie but I know it works great.
customer_reviews.author: second 53

customer_reviews.title: Great product, godd price
customer_reviews.text: It took a little longer because of Hungarian Post but the product works great. It's a bit tricky to connect a wireless printer but the setuo guide is easy to follow and after that everything worked great,
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Lenarth Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and is a 100% improvement over my 6 year old router. Its pretty flat which makes it stand out less on my home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Hibb

customer_reviews.title: Exactly!
customer_reviews.text: Performs exactly as stated. A great product. Easy to use and reliable, The functionality is great , and being able to set up the guest network is an incredibly useful feature. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Weshirecat

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Very Poor
customer_reviews.text: 1, Poor Connection Speed with My Original ASUS F81SE Adapter of Only 130Mbps with Latest Firmware(Both) ( Qualcomm Atheros AR928X 300Mbps ) 2, Random Disconnection. Very Sad on That. ============================================== There were no answers for me [...]). E4200v2 worse than my last $20 router, at least that could get 300Mbps connection speed, but this one only get 130Mbps, also no options to select 40M only by Forcibly. Obviously, a compatibility issue. Im CCNP, not the novice. The most expensive is not the best, Cisco proved.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Better than v1
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't happy with v1. v2 seems to work better. I haven't tried the USB port for a hard drive because it didn't work with v1 and I have a NAS now. Speed tests are much faster especially on the WiFi signal. v1 was so pokey slow that the only decent way to get high speed throughput was through the wire.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: great and easy to install product
customer_reviews.text: despite some reviews saying it was complicated to install and set up...Im a non techy going to take my first Apple basic class today and I had it set up in less than 30 minutes with passwords, guest log in pass words, etc. I did a speed check on my previous linksys "G" wireless network (about 4 to 5 years old) and the speed increased about 70% just by setting this up new N900 router V2. I couldnt be happier with this item...AlsoI ordered on a Saturday, (free shipping of course) and system showed it to be delivered the following Saturday. To my amazement, I was delivered on Tuesday....4 days early which was fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Garry

customer_reviews.title: Problems with quality
customer_reviews.text: I had to send two of these back before I got one that worked. The one I have now is ok, but it was really a pain to have to return two of them because they did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W.

customer_reviews.title: Linksys N900 Router
customer_reviews.text: This works well for me. I 'm a low intensive user. Range is good in my 1400 s.f. single story home. Set-up was easy for this newbe,
customer_reviews.author: Bob 510

customer_reviews.title: Cisco still the best
customer_reviews.text: Great signal strength did everything great. Easy set up just really up to date software neat programs cam with it. I should have bought it first
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Drops connections
customer_reviews.text: I have the E4200 v1. I bought this to put on the other side of my house to get better coverage. First, the range is the same as the v1. It's good, just not better. I had to disconnect this one, though, because the connections it provides are ridiculously slow and drop off for a few minutes every hour.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing product
customer_reviews.text: The router work like all other routers at the 2.4 GHz band. It's star feature the 5 GHz band is a mith. If you are more than 20 feet from the router, signal strength virtually disappears.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Seaman

product_meta.title: Linksys Maximum Performance Dual-Band N900 Router (E4200 v2)
product_meta.description:
Dual-band 3x3 wireless supports high bandwidth applications such as video streaming or file sharing

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Create a maximum performance wireless home network.

Enjoy unrivaled speed and HD/3D quality streaming for the ultimate home theater and gaming experience.



Best-in-class performance for home entertainment, ideal for:

 * Networking large, multi-room homes and home theaters
 * Streaming HD video and music plus multiplayer gaming
 * Transferring and downloading large files
 * Connecting multiple users and devices – TVs, Blu-ray players and game consoles
 * Adding storage and printers



THE CISCO ADVANTAGE
 * Cutting edge technology from the networking leader
 * Best-in-class security
 * 24/7 Award-winning customer support
 * One year hardware limited warranty




See how the E4200v2 stacks up against the rest of the Linksys E-Series routers below.

KEY FEATURES*
 * Maximum speed (up to 450 + 450 Mbps) for faster HD video streaming
 * Simultaneous dual-band to maximize throughput and help avoid network interference
 * Maximum range and reliability with full 3x3 MIMO antenna array
 * Gigabit Ethernet (10/100/1000 Mbps) ports for speeds 10x faster than Ethernet
 * USB port to add storage and printers


MAXIMUM WIRELESS SPEED
The Linksys E4200v2 offers leading wireless speeds for fast video and music streaming. Connect your computers, Internet-ready TVs, game consoles, and other Wi-Fi devices at transfer rates up to 450 + 450 Mbps speed for a premium home network experience.


SUPERIOR WIRELESS COVERAGE
Built with leading 802.11n wireless technology, the Linksys E4200v2 offers maximum range to create a powerful wireless network. Full 3x3 MIMO antenna array boosts signal strength to provide exceptional coverage and reliability so you can enjoy your wireless network from anywhere in your home.


THE POWER OF DUAL-BAND
Double your network bandwidth with dual-band N (2.4 and 5 GHz) designed to avoid interference and maximize throughput for smoother and faster HD video streaming, file transfers, and wireless gaming.


SPEEDBOOST
Higher quality antenna technology helps to maintain high speeds across greater distances throughout your home for maximum wireless coverage and in-home mobility.



The rear of the Linksys E4200v2 with four Gigabit Ethernet ports and a USB 2.0 port 
BENEFITS OF GIGABIT
Use the four Gigabit Ethernet (10/100/1000) ports for quick file sharing, 10x faster than standard Ethernet, between other Gigabit-enabled devices like computers, hard drives, and servers.


ADVANCED SECURITY
Keep Wi-Fi freeloaders and Internet threats at bay with WPA2 encryption and SPI firewall to help keep your network protected.


BUILT-IN USB PORT AND UPNP MEDIA SERVER
The USB port lets you add storage and printers to your network. The built-in UPnP AV Media Server enables seamless streaming of your video and media files to an Xbox 360, PS3, or other UPnP compatible device.


HOME THEATER READY
Bring the ultimate entertainment experience to your home by connecting computers, Internet-ready TVs, game consoles, media players and more to your wireless network and the Internet. QoS traffic prioritization technology designed to deliver your timesensitive Internet traffic efficiently so you can enjoy fast downloads, smooth video and music streaming, and gaming and VoIP.


IPV6 ENABLED
The Linksys E4200v2 supports the latest Internet Protocol technology to future-proof your network.






TECHNICAL SPECS
Model: Linksys E4200v2 Technology: Wireless-N Bands: Simultaneous 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Transmit/Receive: 3 x 3 on 2.4 and 5 GHz Antennas: 6 internal Ethernet Ports x Speed: 4 x Gigabit USB: Yes, Shared Storage, Virtual USB and Media Server Setup: CD Install OS Compatibility: Windows, Mac MINIMUM SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * Internet Browser: Internet Explorer 7, Safari 4, or Firefox 3 or higher for optional browser-based configuration
 * PC: Wi-Fi enabled PC with CD or DVD drive, running Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista SP1, or Windows 7
 * Mac: Wi-Fi enabled Mac with CD or DVD drive, running OS X Leopard 10.5.8 or later or Snow Leopard 10.6 or later

PACKAGE CONTENTS
 * Linksys Linksys E4200v2 Maximum Performance Dual-Band N900 Router
 * Ethernet Cable
 * Power Adapter

PACKAGE DIMENSIONS
12.00” x 9.25” x 2.88 in 


* Maximum performance derived from IEEE Standard 802.11 specifications. Actual performance can vary, including lower wireless network capacity, data throughput rate, range and coverage. Performance depends on many factors, conditions and variables, including distance from the access point, volume of network traffic, building materials and construction, operating system used, mix of wireless products used, interference and other adverse conditions.

See more
feature_bullets: Wireless-N technology uses multiple radios to create a robust signal that travels farther and faster, with reduced dead spots
All Ports support Gigabit speed and Auto-Crossover (MDI/MDI-X) - no need for crossover cables
USB Port Support for USB Printer
Built-in UPnP AV Media Server, streams music, video, and photos to any other compatible media adapter
Guess Access feature allows your visitors access to the Internet, but not your computers or data
Compatible with Wireless-A (802.11a) Wireless-B (802.11b) and Wireless-G (802.11g) standards
